1.verse: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon our dear friend and fellow worker,

2.verse: to Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church that meets in your house:

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: I always thank my God when I remember you in my prayers,

5.verse: because I hear of your love for all the saints and your faith in the Lord Jesus.

6.verse: And I pray that the sharing of your faith may become effective in the knowledge of every good thing that belongs to us in Christ.

7.verse: For I have derived much joy and encouragement from your love, my brother, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed by you.

8.verse: So, although in Christ I have sufficient freedom to order you to do what you ought,

9.verse: yet for love’s sake I prefer to appeal to you—I, Paul, an old man and even now a prisoner for the sake of Christ Jesus—

10.verse: I appeal to you for my child, Onesimus, whose father I became while in prison.

11.verse: Formerly he was of no use to you, but now he has become useful both to you and to me.

12.verse: I am sending him back to you, that is, the one who is my own heart.

13.verse: I wanted to keep him with me, so that he could minister to me on your behalf during my imprisonment for the gospel,

14.verse: but I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that your helpfulness might not be by compulsion but by your own free will.

15.verse: Perhaps he was separated from you for a while for this reason, that you might have him back forever,

16.verse: no longer as a slave, but more than a slave, as a dear brother. He is especially so to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

17.verse: So then if you regard me as a partner, welcome him as you would me.

18.verse: If he has wronged you or owes you anything, charge that to my account—

19.verse: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand—I will pay it back. I could also mention that you owe me your very self!

20.verse: Yes, brother, I do wish that I may have some benefit from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I say.

22.verse: At the same time, prepare a guest room for me, for I am hoping that through your prayers I will be graciously given to you.

23.verse: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings,

24.verse: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

25.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
